Hi folks, I'm using rw with lemmas that require some proof terms to be provided as arguments to those lemmas. These proof terms aren't available in the proof state, but they are very simple to create using a have statement with a single tactic. E.g. have hblabla : MeasurableSet (A \ B) := by measurability.

Now my question is, can I combine the creation of the term hblabla and the rw in one line of code? I.e. rw [measure_union <put proof term for MeasurableSet (A\B) here>]?
Yeah, with (show MeasurableSet (A \ B) by measurability), for example - though I generally doubt that's more readable
Thanks! Readability quickly becomes an issue for sure, but I'll make an exception for myself this one time ;)
Rick de Wolf has marked this topic as resolved.
